BORDER AREA NAY PYI TAW – SHAN .
Fide
Aung et al. (2020: 71)
.
SHAN . Loilen District :
2285 m
,
2 May 1939
,
Dickason 8321
( AMES )
.
Distribution:— The Himalayas, northeastern India , Myanmar and southwestern China .

Notes:— Considering the variability of this species, it seems likely that
C. hitendrae S.Das & S.K.Jain
from India is not different from
C. corymbosa . Dickason 7772
has only a young inflorescence but seems to belong here. Kermode 17357 at AMES is a mixture of a sterile
Coelogyne
plant and a flower of
Cymbidium mastersii Griff. ex Lindl.
in the packet.

Coelogyne ecarinata C.Schweinf.
,
Brittonia
4: 33, 1941. Type :— MYANMAR . Kachin State : Myitkyina District ,
1830 m
,
21 Mar 1939
, Kingdon-Ward 434 ( holotype : AMES; isotype: NY)

Heterotypic synonym: ?
Coelogyne tsii X.H.Jin & H.Li, Ann. Bot. Fenn.
43: 295, 2006.

KACHIN . Putao District :
490 m
,
26 Feb 2007
,

( SING ); same loc.,
Kurzweil & Saw Lwin KL
s.n. ( RAF [s]); Myitkyina District : type
.
Distribution:— Northern Myanmar and southwestern China .

Note:— The correct position of
C. tsii
needs more study. The relationships of
C. ecarinata ,
C. ustulata C.S.P.Parish & Rchb.
f. and
C. tsii
remain unsettled.
